definition: (old) to stand up (after kowtowing)/You may rise.
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
(formal) you may dispense with curtseying
to kowtow in salute
too polite/overcourteous
to stand on ceremony/punctilious
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
I, me (self-referring by a widowed empress etc, used in historical novels and operas)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to salute/to greet
to submit a report to the king/to talk to the king
to kneel down
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to calm down/to quell one's anger
